      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }

            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>
      
        <div class="container-outside" id="issue">
          <aside class="metadata-container">
            <mr-issue-metadata></mr-issue-metadata>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;

          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1358090: Security: heap-use-after-free in CPDF_FormField::ResetField()
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1358090: Security: heap-use-after-free in CPDF_FormField::ResetField()
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      tripl...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1733260721" title="tripl...@gmail.com"><!---->tripl...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      tripl...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->tripl...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Tue, Aug 30, 2022, 10:16 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Aug 30, 2022, 10:16 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          </small>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder {<span class="line"><!---->class CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder {<!----></span><br> // ...<span class="line"><!----> // ...<!----></span><br> std::map<uint32_t, RetainPtr<CPDF_Object>> m_IndirectObjs;<span class="line"><!----> std::map&lt;uint32_t, RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt;&gt; m_IndirectObjs;<!----></span><br> // ...<span class="line"><!----> // ...<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>CPDF_Document inherits CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder and it owns indirect objects used from single pdf document.<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_Document inherits CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder and it owns indirect objects used from single pdf document.<!----></span><br>The key of m_IndirectObjs indicates indirect object number and a value indicates matchted CPDF_Object.<span class="line"><!---->The key of m_IndirectObjs indicates indirect object number and a value indicates matchted CPDF_Object.<!----></span><br><br>It is UAF bug is caused by integer overflow. this issue can be triggerd by combining three primitives.<span class="line"><!---->It is UAF bug is caused by integer overflow. this issue can be triggerd by combining three primitives.<!----></span><br>(1) Increasing last indirect object number<span class="line"><!---->(1) Increasing last indirect object number<!----></span><br>(2) Setting huge last object number<span class="line"><!---->(2) Setting huge last object number<!----></span><br>(3) Overflow checking for last object number is missing<span class="line"><!---->(3) Overflow checking for last object number is missing<!----></span><br><br><br>Once new indirect object is needed (dynamically), it increase last object number(m_LastObjNum) and place newly created object with it.<span class="line"><!---->Once new indirect object is needed (dynamically), it increase last object number(m_LastObjNum) and place newly created object with it.<!----></span><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<span class="line"><!---->// huge number.<!----></span><br>PDFium checks object number during parsing process and limits max object number is 4 * 1024 * 1024.<span class="line"><!---->PDFium checks object number during parsing return m_pDocument-&gt;GetPageDictionary(index);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>For Linearized PDF, CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() tries to get CPDF_Object of page based on hint table. Unlike normal pdf, it is able to set huge object number in hint table[5] and parser doesn't check whether object have huge indirect number[4].<span class="line"><!---->For Linearized PDF, CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() tries to get CPDF_Object of page based on hint table. Unlike normal pdf, it is able to set huge object number in hint table[5] and parser doesn't check whether object have huge indirect number[4].<!----></span><br><br>By combining these primitives, it is possible to free indirect objects owned by CPDF_Document.<span class="line"><!---->By combining these primitives, it is possible to free indirect objects owned by CPDF_Document.<!----></span><br><br>(1) Placing victim(will-be-freed) CPDF_Object with indirect small number like 0, 1, 2 ...<span class="line"><!---->(1) Placing victim(will-be-freed) CPDF_Object with indirect small number like 0, 1, 2 ...<!----></span><br>(2) Setting huge indirect number<span class="line"><!---->(2) Setting huge indirect number<!----></span><br>(3) Create indirect objects repeatedly. m_LastObjNum will be overflowed and objects in front will be replaced and freed by CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject()<span class="line"><!---->(3) Create indirect objects repeatedly. m_LastObjNum will be overflowed and objects in front will be replaced and freed by CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject()<!----></span><br>(4) Dangling pointer is made<span class="line"><!---->(4) Dangling pointer is made<!----></span><br><br>Attached pdf file and sanitizer logs show UAF bug caused from this scenario.<span class="line"><!---->Attached pdf file and sanitizer logs show UAF bug caused from this scenario.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Stable / 107.0.5269.0 (Commit <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Stable / 107.0.5269.0 (Commit <!----></span>396799b65ad67a7ea10bbdeb1d75029d297bb520<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/396799b65ad67a7ea10bbdeb1d75029d297bb520"><!---->396799b65ad67a7ea10bbdeb1d75029d297bb520<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04 x64<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04 x64<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Open `poc.pdf`<span class="line"><!---->Open `poc.pdf`<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: triplepwns<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>By the way, just curious, Is CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() function call in CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() is intended [1]?<span class="line"><!---->By the way, just curious, Is CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() function call in CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() is intended [1]?<!----></span><br>It is only called once CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() call failed [1].<span class="line"><!---->It is only called once CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() call failed [1].<!----></span><br>CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() only fails given dwObjnum is not parsed yet [3].<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() only fails given dwObjnum is not parsed yet [3].<!----></span><br>It means CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() is only called the object is not parsed for given number.<span class="line"><!---->It means CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() is only called the object is not parsed for given number.<!----></span><br><br>But according to its name and comment[4], I think ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() should be called when object is available for given dwObjnum.<span class="line"><!---->But according to its name and comment[4], I think ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() should be called when object is available for given dwObjnum.<!----></span><br>Did I misunderstand the intent?<span class="line"><!---->Did I misunderstand the intent?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Re C2: looks like the object gets added unconditionally if there is no previous object, so while there's a bit of extra work that doesn't have to happen per the reasoning in C2, it should wind up being inserted (despite what the name might say).<span class="line"><!---->Re C2: looks like the object gets added unconditionally if there is no previous object, so while there's a bit of extra work that doesn't have to happen per the reasoning in C2, it should wind up being inserted (despite what the name might say).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        #c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>: The structure of a linearized pdf is not only complex, but I also created a proof-of-concept by fixing many parts of the structure for convenience(e.g. inserting garbage bytes). I've been trying to make a smaller PoC, but unfortunately, it's hard to do with my current structure.<span class="line"><!---->: The structure of a linearized pdf is not only complex, but I also created a proof-of-concept by fixing many parts of the structure for convenience(e.g. inserting garbage bytes). I've been trying to make a smaller PoC, but unfortunately, it's hard to do with my current structure.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;

          box-sizing: border-box;

        }

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }

    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

  :host {

  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.h<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.h<!----></span><br>class CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder {<span class="line"><!---->class CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder {<!----></span><br> // ...<span class="line"><!----> // ...<!----></span><br> std::map<uint32_t, RetainPtr<CPDF_Object>> m_IndirectObjs;<span class="line"><!----> std::map&lt;uint32_t, RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt;&gt; m_IndirectObjs;<!----></span><br> // ...<span class="line"><!----> // ...<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>CPDF_Document inherits CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder and it owns indirect objects used from single pdf document.<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_Document inherits CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder and it owns indirect objects used from single pdf document.<!----></span><br>The key of m_IndirectObjs indicates indirect object number and a value indicates matchted CPDF_Object.<span class="line"><!---->The key of m_IndirectObjs indicates indirect object number and a value indicates matchted CPDF_Object.<!----></span><br><br>It is UAF bug is caused by integer overflow. this issue can be triggerd by combining three primitives.<span class="line"><!---->It is UAF bug is caused by integer overflow. this issue can be triggerd by combining three primitives.<!----></span><br>(1) Increasing last indirect object number<span class="line"><!---->(1) Increasing last indirect object number<!----></span><br>(2) Setting huge last object number<span class="line"><!---->(2) Setting huge last object number<!----></span><br>(3) Overflow checking for last object number is missing<span class="line"><!---->(3) Overflow checking for last object number is missing<!----></span><br><br><br>Once new indirect object is needed (dynamically), it increase last object number(m_LastObjNum) and place newly created object with it.<span class="line"><!---->Once new indirect object is needed (dynamically), it increase last object number(m_LastObjNum) and place newly created object with it.<!----></span><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<!----></span><br>CPDF_Object* CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject(<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_Object* CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject(<!----></span><br>    RetainPtr<CPDF_Object> pObj) {<span class="line"><!---->    RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt; pObj) {<!----></span><br>  CHECK(!pObj->GetObjNum());<span class="line"><!---->  CHECK(!pObj-&gt;GetObjNum());<!----></span><br>  pObj->SetObjNum(++m_LastObjNum);<span class="line"><!---->  pObj-&gt;SetObjNum(++m_LastObjNum);<!----></span><br><br>  auto& obj_holder = m_IndirectObjs[m_LastObjNum];<span class="line"><!---->  auto&amp; obj_holder = m_IndirectObjs[m_LastObjNum];<!----></span><br>  obj_holder = std::move(pObj);<span class="line"><!---->  obj_holder = std::move(pObj);<!----></span><br>  return obj_holder.Get();<span class="line"><!---->  return obj_holder.Get();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>The last object number, m_LastObjNum, also be updated once higher indirect object is parsed[1][2].<span class="line"><!---->The last object number, m_LastObjNum, also be updated once higher indirect object is parsed[1][2].<!----></span><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<!----></span><br>CPDF_Object* CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetOrParseIndirectObject(<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_Object* CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetOrParseIndirectObject(<!----></span><br>    uint32_t objnum) {<span class="line"><!---->    uint32_t objnum) {<!----></span><br>  if (objnum == 0 || objnum == CPDF_Object::kInvalidObjNum)<span class="line"><!---->  if (objnum == 0 || objnum == CPDF_Object::kInvalidObjNum)<!----></span><br>    return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    return nullptr;<!----></span><br><br>  // Add item anyway to prevent recursively parsing of same object.<span class="line"><!---->  // Add item anyway to prevent recursively parsing of same object.<!----></span><br>  auto insert_result = m_IndirectObjs.insert(std::make_pair(objnum, nullptr));<span class="line"><!---->  auto insert_result = m_IndirectObjs.insert(std::make_pair(objnum, nullptr));<!----></span><br>  if (!insert_result.second)<span class="line"><!---->  if (!insert_result.second)<!----></span><br>    return FilterInvalidObjNum(insert_result.first->second.Get());<span class="line"><!---->    return FilterInvalidObjNum(insert_result.first-&gt;second.Get());<!----></span><br><br>  RetainPtr<CPDF_Object> pNewObj = ParseIndirectObject(objnum);<span class="line"><!---->  RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt; pNewObj = ParseIndirectObject(objnum);<!----></span><br>  if (!pNewObj) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (!pNewObj) {<!----></span><br>    m_IndirectObjs.erase(insert_result.first);<span class="line"><!---->    m_IndirectObjs.erase(insert_result.first);<!----></span><br>    return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    return nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  pNewObj->SetObjNum(objnum);<span class="line"><!---->  pNewObj-&gt;SetObjNum(objnum);<!----></span><br>  m_LastObjNum = std::max(m_LastObjNum, objnum);  // ***** 1 *****<span class="line"><!---->  m_LastObjNum = std::max(m_LastObjNum, objnum);  // ***** 1 *****<!----></span><br>  insert_result.first->second = std::move(pNewObj);<span class="line"><!---->  insert_result.first-&gt;second = std::move(pNewObj);<!----></span><br>  return insert_result.first->second.Get();<span class="line"><!---->  return insert_result.first-&gt;second.Get();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>bool CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration(<span class="line"><!---->bool CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration(<!----></span><br>    uint32_t objnum,<span class="line"><!---->    uint32_t objnum,<!----></span><br>    RetainPtr<CPDF_Object> pObj) {<span class="line"><!---->    RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt; pObj) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(objnum);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(objnum);<!----></span><br>  if (!pObj || objnum == CPDF_Object::kInvalidObjNum)<span class="line"><!---->  if (!pObj || objnum == CPDF_Object::kInvalidObjNum)<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br><br>  auto& obj_holder = m_IndirectObjs[objnum];<span class="line"><!---->  auto&amp; obj_holder = m_IndirectObjs[objnum];<!----></span><br>  const CPDF_Object* old_object = FilterInvalidObjNum(obj_holder.Get());<span class="line"><!---->  const CPDF_Object* old_object = FilterInvalidObjNum(obj_holder.Get());<!----></span><br>  if (old_object && pObj->GetGenNum() <= old_object->GetGenNum())<span class="line"><!---->  if (old_object &amp;&amp; pObj-&gt;GetGenNum() &lt;= old_object-&gt;GetGenNum())<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br><br>  pObj->SetObjNum(objnum);<span class="line"><!---->  pObj-&gt;SetObjNum(objnum);<!----></span><br>  obj_holder = std::move(pObj);<span class="line"><!---->  obj_holder = std::move(pObj);<!----></span><br>  m_LastObjNum = std::max(m_LastObjNum, objnum);  // ***** 2 *****<span class="line"><!---->  m_LastObjNum = std::max(m_LastObjNum, objnum);  // ***** 2 *****<!----></span><br>  return true;<span class="line"><!---->  return true;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>Normally PDF document cannot have object with extremely huge number.<span class="line"><!---->Normally PDF document cannot have object with extremely huge number.<!----></span><br>PDFium checks object number during parsing process and limits max object number is 4 * 1024 * 1024.<span class="line"><!---->PDFium checks object number during parsing process and limits max object number is 4 * 1024 * 1024.<!----></span><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_parser.h<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_parser.h<!----></span><br><br>  // A limit on the maximum object number in the xref table. Theoretical limits<span class="line"><!---->  // A limit on the maximum object number in the xref table. Theoretical limits<!----></span><br>  // are higher, but this may be large enough in practice.<span class="line"><!---->  // are higher, but this may be large enough in practice.<!----></span><br>  // Note: This was 1M, but <span class="line"><!---->  // Note: This was 1M, but <!----></span>https://crbug.com/910009<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=910009" title="Large PDF refuses to render in Chrome"><!---->https://crbug.com/910009<!----></a> encountered a PDF with<span class="line"><!----> encountered a PDF with<!----></span><br>  // object numbers in the 1.7M range. The PDF only has 10K objects, but they<span class="line"><!---->  // object numbers in the 1.7M range. The PDF only has 10K objects, but they<!----></span><br>  // are non-consecutive.<span class="line"><!---->  // are non-consecutive.<!----></span><br>  static constexpr uint32_t kMaxObjectNumber = 4 * 1024 * 1024;<span class="line"><!---->  static constexpr uint32_t kMaxObjectNumber = 4 * 1024 * 1024;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_hint_tables.cpp<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_hint_tables.cpp<!----></span><br>bool CPDF_HintTables::ReadPageHintTable(CFX_BitStream* hStream) {<span class="line"><!---->bool CPDF_HintTables::ReadPageHintTable(CFX_BitStream* hStream) {<!----></span><br>  // ...<span class="line"><!---->  // ...<!----></span><br>  uint32_t dwStartObjNum = 1;<span class="line"><!---->  uint32_t dwStartObjNum = 1;<!----></span><br>  for (uint32_t i = 0; i < nPages; ++i) {<span class="line"><!---->  for (uint32_t i = 0; i &lt; nPages; ++i) {<!----></span><br>    FX_SAFE_UINT32 safeDeltaObj = hStream->GetBits(dwDeltaObjectsBits);<span class="line"><!---->    FX_SAFE_UINT32 safeDeltaObj = hStream-&gt;GetBits(dwDeltaObjectsBits);<!----></span><br>    safeDeltaObj += dwObjLeastNum;<span class="line"><!---->    safeDeltaObj += dwObjLeastNum;<!----></span><br>    if (!safeDeltaObj.IsValid())<span class="line"><!---->    if (!safeDeltaObj.IsValid())<!----></span><br>      return false;<span class="line"><!---->      return false;<!----></span><br>    m_PageInfos[i].set_objects_count(safeDeltaObj.ValueOrDie());<span class="line"><!----> (!bPagePosGot || !dwObjNum)<!----></span><br>    return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    return nullptr;<!----></span><br>  // We should say to the document, which object is the page.<span class="line"><!---->  // We should say to the document, which object is the page.<!----></span><br>  m_pDocument->SetPageObjNum(index, dwObjNum);<span class="line"><!----> document.<!----></span><br>  if (!m_pDocument->GetIndirectObject(dwObjNum)) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (!m_pDocument-&gt;GetIndirectObject(dwObjNum)) {<!----></span><br>        dwObjNum,<!----></span><br>        ParseIndirectObjectAt(szPageStartPos, dwObjNum, m_pDocument.Get()));  // ***** 4 *****<span class="line"><!---->        ParseIndirectObjectAt(szPageStartPos, dwObjNum, m_pDocument.Get()));  // ***** 4 *****<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  if (!ValidatePage(index))<span class="line"><!---->  if (!ValidatePage(index))<!----></span><br>    return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    return nullptr;<!----></span><br>  return m_pDocument->GetPageDictionary(index);<span class="line"><!----> CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() tries to get CPDF_Object of page based on hint table. Unlike normal pdf, it is able to set huge object number in hint table[5] and parser doesn't check whether object have huge indirect number[4].<span class="line"><!---->For Linearized PDF, CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() tries to get CPDF_Object of page based on hint table. Unlike normal pdf, it is able to set huge object number in hint table[5] and parser doesn't check whether object have huge indirect number[4].<!----></span><br><br>By combining these primitives, it is possible to free indirect objects owned by CPDF_Document.<span class="line"><!---->By combining these primitives, it is possible to free indirect objects owned by CPDF_Document.<!----></span><br><br>(1) Placing victim(will-be-freed) CPDF_Object with indirect small number like 0, 1, 2 ...<span class="line"><!---->(1) Placing victim(will-be-freed) CPDF_Object with indirect small number like 0, 1, 2 ...<!----></span><br>(2) Setting huge indirect number<span class="line"><!---->(2) Setting huge indirect number<!----></span><br>(3) Create indirect objects repeatedly. m_LastObjNum will be overflowed and objects in front will be replaced and freed by CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject()<span class="line"><!---->(3) Create indirect objects repeatedly. m_LastObjNum will be overflowed and objects in front will be replaced and freed by CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject()<!----></span><br>(4) Dangling pointer is made<span class="line"><!---->(4) Dangling pointer is made<!----></span><br><br>Attached pdf file and sanitizer logs show UAF bug caused from this scenario.<span class="line"><!---->Attached pdf file and sanitizer logs show UAF bug caused from this scenario.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Stable / 107.0.5269.0 (Commit <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Stable / 107.0.5269.0 (Commit <!----></span>396799b65ad67a7ea10bbdeb1d75029d297bb520<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/396799b65ad67a7ea10bbdeb1d75029d297bb520"><!---->396799b65ad67a7ea10bbdeb1d75029d297bb520<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04 x64<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04 x64<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Open `poc.pdf`<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>By the way, just curious, Is CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() function call in CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() is intended [1]?<span class="line"><!---->By the way, just curious, Is CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() function call in CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() is intended [1]?<!----></span><br>It is only called once CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() call failed [1].<span class="line"><!---->It is only called once CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() call failed [1].<!----></span><br>CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() only fails given dwObjnum is not parsed yet [3].<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() only fails given dwObjnum is not parsed yet [3].<!----></span><br>It means CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() is only called the object is not parsed for given number.<span class="line"><!---->It means CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() is only called the object is not parsed for given number.<!----></span><br><br>But according to its name and comment[4], I think ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() should be called when object is available for given dwObjnum.<span class="line"><!---->But according to its name and comment[4], I think ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() should be called when object is available for given dwObjnum.<!----></span><br>Did I misunderstand the intent?<span class="line"><!---->Did I misunderstand the intent?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1358090#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by

        Re C2: looks like the object gets added unconditionally if there is no previous object, so while there's a bit of extra work that doesn't have to happen per the reasoning in C2, it should wind up being inserted (despite what the name might say).<span class="line"><!---->Re C2: looks like the object gets added unconditionally if there is no previous object, so while there's a bit of extra work that doesn't have to happen per the reasoning in C2, it should wind up being inserted (despite what the name might say).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        #c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>: The structure of a linearized pdf is not only complex, but I also created a proof-of-concept by fixing many parts of the structure for convenience(e.g. inserting garbage bytes). I've been trying to make a smaller PoC, but unfortunately, it's hard to do with my current structure.<span class="line"><!---->: The structure of a linearized pdf is not only complex, but I also created a proof-of-concept by fixing many parts of the structure for convenience(e.g. inserting garbage bytes). I've been trying to make a smaller PoC, but unfortunately, it's hard to do with my current structure.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>

        <tbody>
          <tr>
            
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Summary<!----></th>
            <!---->
          </tr>

          
        </tbody><table><tbody>
          <tr>
            
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Summary<!----></th>
            <!---->
          </tr>

          
        </tbody></table>
      <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">

            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        }

          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

          overflow-y: auto;

        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1358090: Security: heap-use-after-free in CPDF_FormField::ResetField()
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1358090: Security: heap-use-after-free in CPDF_FormField::ResetField()
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      tripl...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1733260721" title="tripl...@gmail.com"><!---->tripl...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      tripl...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->tripl...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Tue, Aug 30, 2022, 10:16 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Aug 30, 2022, 10:16 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Aug 30, 2022, 10:16 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1358090: Security: heap-use-after-free in CPDF_FormField::ResetField()
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">

            on <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Aug 30, 2022, 10:16 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
