class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>By the way, just curious, Is CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() function call in CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() is intended [1]?<span class="line"><!---->By the way, just curious, Is CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() function call in CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() is intended [1]?<!----></span><br>It is only called once CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() call failed [1].<span class="line"><!---->It is only called once CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() call failed [1].<!----></span><br>CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() only fails given dwObjnum is not parsed yet [3].<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() only fails given dwObjnum is not parsed yet [3].<!----></span><br>It means CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() is only called the object is not parsed for given number.<span class="line"><!---->It means CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() is only called the object is not parsed for given number.<!----></span><br><br>But according to its name and comment[4], I think ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() should be called when object is available for given dwObjnum.<span class="line"><!---->But according to its name and comment[4], I think ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() should be called when object is available for given dwObjnum.<!----></span><br>Did I misunderstand the intent?<span class="line"><!---->Did I misunderstand the intent?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        #c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>: The structure of a linearized pdf is not only complex, but I also created a proof-of-concept by fixing many parts of the structure for convenience(e.g. inserting garbage bytes). I've been trying to make a smaller PoC, but unfortunately, it's hard to do with my current structure.<span class="line"><!---->: The structure of a linearized pdf is not only complex, but I also created a proof-of-concept by fixing many parts of the structure for convenience(e.g. inserting garbage bytes). I've been trying to make a smaller PoC, but unfortunately, it's hard to do with my current structure.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-10000
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.h<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.h<!----></span><br>class CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder {<span class="line"><!---->class CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder {<!----></span><br> // ...<span class="line"><!----> // ...<!----></span><br> std::map<uint32_t, RetainPtr<CPDF_Object>> m_IndirectObjs;<span class="line"><!----> std::map&lt;uint32_t, RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt;&gt; m_IndirectObjs;<!----></span><br> // ...<span class="line"><!----> // ...<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>CPDF_Document inherits CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder and it owns indirect objects used from single pdf document.<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_Document inherits CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder and it owns indirect objects used from single pdf document.<!----></span><br>The key of m_IndirectObjs indicates indirect object number and a value indicates matchted CPDF_Object.<span class="line"><!---->The key of m_IndirectObjs indicates indirect object number and a value indicates matchted CPDF_Object.<!----></span><br><br>It is UAF bug is caused by integer overflow. this issue can be triggerd by combining three primitives.<span class="line"><!---->It is UAF bug is caused by integer overflow. this issue can be triggerd by combining three primitives.<!----></span><br>(1) Increasing last indirect object number<span class="line"><!---->(1) Increasing last indirect object number<!----></span><br>(2) Setting huge last object number<span class="line"><!---->(2) Setting huge last object number<!----></span><br>(3) Overflow checking for last object number is missing<span class="line"><!---->(3) Overflow checking for last object number is missing<!----></span><br><br><br>Once new indirect object is needed (dynamically), it increase last object number(m_LastObjNum) and place newly created object with it.<span class="line"><!---->Once new indirect object is needed (dynamically), it increase last object number(m_LastObjNum) and place newly created object with it.<!----></span><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<!----></span><br>CPDF_Object* CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject(<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_Object* CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject(<!----></span><br>    RetainPtr<CPDF_Object> pObj) {<span class="line"><!---->    RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt; pObj) {<!----></span><br>  CHECK(!pObj->GetObjNum());<span class="line"><!---->  CHECK(!pObj-&gt;GetObjNum());<!----></span><br>  pObj->SetObjNum(++m_LastObjNum);<span class="line"><!---->  pObj-&gt;SetObjNum(++m_LastObjNum);<!----></span><br><br>  auto& obj_holder = m_IndirectObjs[m_LastObjNum];<span class="line"><!---->  auto&amp; obj_holder = m_IndirectObjs[m_LastObjNum];<!----></span><br>  obj_holder = std::move(pObj);<span class="line"><!---->  obj_holder = std::move(pObj);<!----></span><br>  return obj_holder.Get();<span class="line"><!---->  return obj_holder.Get();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>The last object number, m_LastObjNum, also be updated once higher indirect object is parsed[1][2].<span class="line"><!---->The last object number, m_LastObjNum, also be updated once higher indirect object is parsed[1][2].<!----></span><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<!----></span><br>CPDF_Object* CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetOrParseIndirectObject(<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_Object* CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetOrParseIndirectObject(<!----></span><br>    uint32_t objnum) {<span class="line"><!---->    uint32_t objnum) {<!----></span><br>  if (objnum == 0 || objnum == CPDF_Object::kInvalidObjNum)<span class="line"><!---->  if (objnum == 0 || objnum == CPDF_Object::kInvalidObjNum)<!----></span><br>    return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    return nullptr;<!----></span><br><br>  // Add item anyway to prevent recursively parsing of same object.<span class="line"><!---->  // Add item anyway to prevent recursively parsing of same object.<!----></span><br>  auto insert_result = m_IndirectObjs.insert(std::make_pair(objnum, nullptr));<span class="line"><!---->  auto insert_result = m_IndirectObjs.insert(std::make_pair(objnum, nullptr));<!----></span><br>  if (!insert_result.second)<span class="line"><!---->  if (!insert_result.second)<!----></span><br>    return FilterInvalidObjNum(insert_result.first->second.Get());<span class="line"><!---->    return FilterInvalidObjNum(insert_result.first-&gt;second.Get());<!----></span><br><br>  RetainPtr<CPDF_Object> pNewObj = ParseIndirectObject(objnum);<span class="line"><!---->  RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt; pNewObj = ParseIndirectObject(objnum);<!----></span><br>  if (!pNewObj) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (!pNewObj) {<!----></span><br>    m_IndirectObjs.erase(insert_result.first);<span class="line"><!---->    m_IndirectObjs.erase(insert_result.first);<!----></span><br>    return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    return nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  pNewObj->SetObjNum(objnum);<span class="line"><!---->  pNewObj-&gt;SetObjNum(objnum);<!----></span><br>  m_LastObjNum = std::max(m_LastObjNum, objnum);  // ***** 1 *****<span class="line"><!---->  m_LastObjNum = std::max(m_LastObjNum, objnum);  // ***** 1 *****<!----></span><br>  insert_result.first->second = std::move(pNewObj);<span class="line"><!---->  insert_result.first-&gt;second = std::move(pNewObj);<!----></span><br>  return insert_result.first->second.Get();<span class="line"><!---->  return insert_result.first-&gt;second.Get();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>bool CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration(<span class="line"><!---->bool CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration(<!----></span><br>    uint32_t objnum,<span class="line"><!---->    uint32_t objnum,<!----></span><br>    RetainPtr<CPDF_Object> pObj) {<span class="line"><!---->    RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt; pObj) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(objnum);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(objnum);<!----></span><br>  if (!pObj || objnum == CPDF_Object::kInvalidObjNum)<span class="line"><!---->  if (!pObj || objnum == CPDF_Object::kInvalidObjNum)<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br><br>  auto& obj_holder = m_IndirectObjs[objnum];<span class="line"><!---->  auto&amp; obj_holder = m_IndirectObjs[objnum];<!----></span><br>  const CPDF_Object* old_object = FilterInvalidObjNum(obj_holder.Get());<span class="line"><!---->  const CPDF_Object* old_object = FilterInvalidObjNum(obj_holder.Get());<!----></span><br>  if (old_object && pObj->GetGenNum() <= old_object->GetGenNum())<span class="line"><!---->  if (old_object &amp;&amp; pObj-&gt;GetGenNum() &lt;= old_object-&gt;GetGenNum())<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br><br>  pObj->SetObjNum(objnum);<span class="line"><!---->  pObj-&gt;SetObjNum(objnum);<!----></span><br>  obj_holder = std::move(pObj);<span class="line"><!---->  obj_holder = std::move(pObj);<!----></span><br>  m_LastObjNum = std::max(m_LastObjNum, objnum);  // ***** 2 *****<span class="line"><!---->  m_LastObjNum = std::max(m_LastObjNum, objnum);  // ***** 2 *****<!----></span><br>  return true;<span class="line"><!---->  return true;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>Normally PDF document cannot have object with extremely huge number.<span class="line"><!---->Normally PDF document cannot have object with extremely huge number.<!----></span><br>PDFium checks object number during parsing process and limits max object number is 4 * 1024 * 1024.<span class="line"><!---->PDFium checks object number during parsing process and limits max object number is 4 * 1024 * 1024.<!----></span><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_parser.h<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_parser.h<!----></span><br><br>  // A limit on the maximum object number in the xref table. Theoretical limits<span class="line"><!---->  // A limit on the maximum object number in the xref table. Theoretical limits<!----></span><br>  // are higher, but this may be large enough in practice.<span class="line"><!---->  // are higher, but this may be large enough in practice.<!----></span><br>  // Note: This was 1M, but <span class="line"><!---->  // Note: This was 1M, but <!----></span>https://crbug.com/910009<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=910009" title="Large PDF refuses to render in Chrome"><!---->https://crbug.com/910009<!----></a> encountered a PDF with<span class="line"><!----> encountered a PDF with<!----></span><br>  // object numbers in the 1.7M range. CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() tries to get CPDF_Object of page based on hint table. Unlike normal pdf, it is able to set huge object number in hint table[5] and parser doesn't check whether object have huge indirect number[4].<span class="line"><!---->For Linearized PDF, CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() tries to get CPDF_Object of page based on hint table. Unlike normal pdf, it is able to set huge object number in hint table[5] and parser doesn't check whether object have huge indirect number[4].<!----></span><br><br>By combining these primitives, it is possible to free indirect objects owned by CPDF_Document.<span class="line"><!---->By combining these primitives, it is possible to free indirect objects owned by CPDF_Document.<!----></span><br><br>(1) Placing victim(will-be-freed) CPDF_Object with indirect small number like 0, 1, 2 ...<span class="line"><!---->(1) Placing victim(will-be-freed) CPDF_Object with indirect small number like 0, 1, 2 ...<!----></span><br>(2) Setting huge indirect number<span class="line"><!---->(2) Setting huge indirect number<!----></span><br>(3) Create indirect objects repeatedly. m_LastObjNum will be overflowed and objects in front will be replaced and freed by CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject()<span class="line"><!---->(3) Create indirect objects repeatedly. m_LastObjNum will be overflowed and objects in front will be replaced and freed by CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject()<!----></span><br>(4) Dangling pointer is made<span class="line"><!---->(4) Dangling pointer is made<!----></span><br><br>Attached pdf file and sanitizer logs show UAF bug caused from this scenario.<span class="line"><!---->Attached pdf file and sanitizer logs show UAF bug caused from this scenario.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Stable / 107.0.5269.0 (Commit <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Stable / 107.0.5269.0 (Commit <!----></span>396799b65ad67a7ea10bbdeb1d75029d297bb520<a class="undefined" target="_blank" x64<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04 x64<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Open `poc.pdf`<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>By the way, just curious, Is CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() function call in CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() is intended [1]?<span class="line"><!---->By the way, just curious, Is CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() function call in CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() is intended [1]?<!----></span><br>It is only called once CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() call failed [1].<span class="line"><!---->It is only called once CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() call failed [1].<!----></span><br>CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() only fails given dwObjnum is not parsed yet [3].<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() only fails given dwObjnum is not parsed yet [3].<!----></span><br>It means CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() is only called the object is not parsed for given number.<span class="line"><!---->It means CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() is only called the object is not parsed for given number.<!----></span><br><br>But according to its name and comment[4], I think ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() should be called when object is available for given dwObjnum.<span class="line"><!---->But according to its name and comment[4], I think ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() should be called when object is available for given dwObjnum.<!----></span><br>Did I misunderstand the intent?<span class="line"><!---->Did I misunderstand the intent?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        #c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>: The structure of a linearized pdf is not only complex, but I also created a proof-of-concept by fixing many parts of the structure for convenience(e.g. inserting garbage bytes). I've been trying to make a smaller PoC, but unfortunately, it's hard to do with my current structure.<span class="line"><!---->: The structure of a linearized pdf is not only complex, but I also created a proof-of-concept by fixing many parts of the structure for convenience(e.g. inserting garbage bytes). I've been trying to make a smaller PoC, but unfortunately, it's hard to do with my current structure.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        1. Just <span class="line"><!---->1. Just <!----></span>https://pdfium-review.googlesource.com/c/pdfium/+/97751<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://pdfium-review.googlesource.com/c/pdfium/+/97751"><!---->https://pdfium-review.googlesource.com/c/pdfium/+/97751<!----></a><br>2.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.h<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.h<!----></span><br>class CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder {<span class="line"><!---->class CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder {<!----></span><br> // ...<span class="line"><!----> // ...<!----></span><br> std::map<uint32_t, RetainPtr<CPDF_Object>> m_IndirectObjs;<span class="line"><!----> std::map&lt;uint32_t, RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt;&gt; m_IndirectObjs;<!----></span><br> // ...<span class="line"><!----> // ...<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>CPDF_Document inherits CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder and it owns indirect objects used from single pdf document.<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_Document inherits CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder and it owns indirect objects used from single pdf document.<!----></span><br>The key of m_IndirectObjs indicates indirect object number and a value indicates matchted CPDF_Object.<span class="line"><!---->The key of m_IndirectObjs indicates indirect object number and a value indicates matchted CPDF_Object.<!----></span><br><br>It is UAF bug is caused by integer overflow. this issue can be triggerd by combining three primitives.<span class="line"><!---->It is UAF bug is caused by integer overflow. this issue can be triggerd by combining three primitives.<!----></span><br>(1) Increasing last indirect object number<span class="line"><!---->(1) Increasing last indirect object number<!----></span><br>(2) Setting huge last object number<span class="line"><!---->(2) Setting huge last object number<!----></span><br>(3) Overflow checking for last object number is missing<span class="line"><!---->(3) Overflow checking for last object number is missing<!----></span><br><br><br>Once new indirect object is needed (dynamically), it increase last object number(m_LastObjNum) and place newly created object with it.<span class="line"><!---->Once new indirect object is needed (dynamically), it increase last object number(m_LastObjNum) and place newly created object with it.<!----></span><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<!----></span><br>CPDF_Object* CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject(<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_Object* CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject(<!----></span><br>    RetainPtr<CPDF_Object> pObj) {<span class="line"><!---->    RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt; pObj) {<!----></span><br>  CHECK(!pObj->GetObjNum());<span class="line"><!---->  CHECK(!pObj-&gt;GetObjNum());<!----></span><br>  pObj->SetObjNum(++m_LastObjNum);<span class="line"><!---->  pObj-&gt;SetObjNum(++m_LastObjNum);<!----></span><br><br>  auto& obj_holder = m_IndirectObjs[m_LastObjNum];<span class="line"><!---->  auto&amp; obj_holder = m_IndirectObjs[m_LastObjNum];<!----></span><br>  obj_holder = std::move(pObj);<span class="line"><!---->  obj_holder = std::move(pObj);<!----></span><br>  return obj_holder.Get();<span class="line"><!---->  return obj_holder.Get();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>The last object number, m_LastObjNum, also be updated once higher indirect object is parsed[1][2].<span class="line"><!---->The last object number, m_LastObjNum, also be updated once higher indirect object is parsed[1][2].<!----></span><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_indirect_object_holder.cpp<!----></span><br>CPDF_Object* CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetOrParseIndirectObject(<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_Object* CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetOrParseIndirectObject(<!----></span><br>    uint32_t objnum) {<span class="line"><!---->    uint32_t objnum) {<!----></span><br>  if (objnum == 0 || objnum == CPDF_Object::kInvalidObjNum)<span class="line"><!---->  if (objnum == 0 || objnum == CPDF_Object::kInvalidObjNum)<!----></span><br>    return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    return nullptr;<!----></span><br><br>  // Add item anyway to prevent recursively parsing of same object.<span class="line"><!---->  // Add item anyway to prevent recursively parsing of same object.<!----></span><br>  auto insert_result = m_IndirectObjs.insert(std::make_pair(objnum, nullptr));<span class="line"><!---->  auto insert_result = m_IndirectObjs.insert(std::make_pair(objnum, nullptr));<!----></span><br>  if (!insert_result.second)<span class="line"><!---->  if (!insert_result.second)<!----></span><br>    return FilterInvalidObjNum(insert_result.first->second.Get());<span class="line"><!---->    return FilterInvalidObjNum(insert_result.first-&gt;second.Get());<!----></span><br><br>  RetainPtr<CPDF_Object> pNewObj = ParseIndirectObject(objnum);<span class="line"><!---->  RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt; pNewObj = ParseIndirectObject(objnum);<!----></span><br>  if (!pNewObj) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (!pNewObj) {<!----></span><br>    m_IndirectObjs.erase(insert_result.first);<span class="line"><!---->    m_IndirectObjs.erase(insert_result.first);<!----></span><br>    return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    return nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  pNewObj->SetObjNum(objnum);<span class="line"><!---->  pNewObj-&gt;SetObjNum(objnum);<!----></span><br>  m_LastObjNum = std::max(m_LastObjNum, objnum);  // ***** 1 *****<span class="line"><!---->  m_LastObjNum = std::max(m_LastObjNum, objnum);  // ***** 1 *****<!----></span><br>  insert_result.first->second = std::move(pNewObj);<span class="line"><!---->  insert_result.first-&gt;second = std::move(pNewObj);<!----></span><br>  return insert_result.first->second.Get();<span class="line"><!---->  return insert_result.first-&gt;second.Get();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>bool CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration(<span class="line"><!---->bool CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration(<!----></span><br>    uint32_t objnum,<span class="line"><!---->    uint32_t objnum,<!----></span><br>    RetainPtr<CPDF_Object> pObj) {<span class="line"><!---->    RetainPtr&lt;CPDF_Object&gt; pObj) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(objnum);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(objnum);<!----></span><br>  if (!pObj || objnum == CPDF_Object::kInvalidObjNum)<span class="line"><!---->  if (!pObj || objnum == CPDF_Object::kInvalidObjNum)<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br><br>  auto& obj_holder = m_IndirectObjs[objnum];<span class="line"><!---->  auto&amp; obj_holder = m_IndirectObjs[objnum];<!----></span><br>  const CPDF_Object* old_object = FilterInvalidObjNum(obj_holder.Get());<span class="line"><!---->  const CPDF_Object* old_object = FilterInvalidObjNum(obj_holder.Get());<!----></span><br>  if (old_object && pObj->GetGenNum() <= old_object->GetGenNum())<span class="line"><!---->  if (old_object &amp;&amp; pObj-&gt;GetGenNum() &lt;= old_object-&gt;GetGenNum())<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br><br>  pObj->SetObjNum(objnum);<span class="line"><!---->  pObj-&gt;SetObjNum(objnum);<!----></span><br>  obj_holder = std::move(pObj);<span class="line"><!---->  obj_holder = std::move(pObj);<!----></span><br>  m_LastObjNum = std::max(m_LastObjNum, objnum);  // ***** 2 *****<span class="line"><!---->  m_LastObjNum = std::max(m_LastObjNum, objnum);  // ***** 2 *****<!----></span><br>  return true;<span class="line"><!---->  return true;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>Normally PDF document cannot have object with extremely huge number.<span class="line"><!---->Normally PDF document cannot have object with extremely huge number.<!----></span><br>PDFium checks object number during parsing process and limits max object number is 4 * 1024 * 1024.<span class="line"><!---->PDFium checks object number during parsing process and limits max object number is 4 * 1024 * 1024.<!----></span><br>```cpp<span class="line"><!---->```cpp<!----></span><br>// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_parser.h<span class="line"><!---->// third_party/pdfium/core/fpdfapi/parser/cpdf_parser.h<!----></span><br><br>  // A limit on the maximum object number in the xref table. Theoretical limits<span class="line"><!---->  // A limit on the maximum object number in the xref table. CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() tries to get CPDF_Object of page based on hint table. Unlike normal pdf, it is able to set huge object number in hint table[5] and parser doesn't check whether object have huge indirect number[4].<span class="line"><!---->For Linearized PDF, CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() tries to get CPDF_Object of page based on hint table. Unlike normal pdf, it is able to set huge object number in hint table[5] and parser doesn't check whether object have huge indirect number[4].<!----></span><br><br>By combining these primitives, it is possible to free indirect objects owned by CPDF_Document.<span class="line"><!---->By combining these primitives, it is possible to free indirect objects owned by CPDF_Document.<!----></span><br><br>(1) Placing victim(will-be-freed) CPDF_Object with indirect small number like 0, 1, 2 ...<span class="line"><!---->(1) Placing victim(will-be-freed) CPDF_Object with indirect small number like 0, 1, 2 ...<!----></span><br>(2) Setting huge indirect number<span class="line"><!---->(2) Setting huge indirect number<!----></span><br>(3) Create indirect objects repeatedly. m_LastObjNum will be overflowed and objects in front will be replaced and freed by CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject()<span class="line"><!---->(3) Create indirect objects repeatedly. m_LastObjNum will be overflowed and objects in front will be replaced and freed by CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::AddIndirectObject()<!----></span><br>(4) Dangling pointer is made<span class="line"><!---->(4) Dangling pointer is made<!----></span><br><br>Attached pdf file and sanitizer logs show UAF bug caused from this scenario.<span class="line"><!---->Attached pdf file and sanitizer logs show UAF bug caused from this scenario.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Stable / 107.0.5269.0 (Commit <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Stable / 107.0.5269.0 (Commit <!----></span>396799b65ad67a7ea10bbdeb1d75029d297bb520<a class="undefined" target="_blank" x64<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04 x64<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Open `poc.pdf`<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>By the way, just curious, Is CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() function call in CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() is intended [1]?<span class="line"><!---->By the way, just curious, Is CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() function call in CPDF_DataAvail::GetPageDictionary() is intended [1]?<!----></span><br>It is only called once CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() call failed [1].<span class="line"><!---->It is only called once CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() call failed [1].<!----></span><br>CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() only fails given dwObjnum is not parsed yet [3].<span class="line"><!---->CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::GetIndirectObject() only fails given dwObjnum is not parsed yet [3].<!----></span><br>It means CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() is only called the object is not parsed for given number.<span class="line"><!---->It means CPDF_IndirectObjectHolder::ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() is only called the object is not parsed for given number.<!----></span><br><br>But according to its name and comment[4], I think ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() should be called when object is available for given dwObjnum.<span class="line"><!---->But according to its name and comment[4], I think ReplaceIndirectObjectIfHigherGeneration() should be called when object is available for given dwObjnum.<!----></span><br>Did I misunderstand the intent?<span class="line"><!---->Did I misunderstand the intent?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        #c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>: The structure of a linearized pdf is not only complex, but I also created a proof-of-concept by fixing many parts of the structure for convenience(e.g. inserting garbage bytes). I've been trying to make a smaller PoC, but unfortunately, it's hard to do with my current structure.<span class="line"><!---->: The structure of a linearized pdf is not only complex, but I also created a proof-of-concept by fixing many parts of the structure for convenience(e.g. inserting garbage bytes). I've been trying to make a smaller PoC, but unfortunately, it's hard to do with my current structure.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        1. Just <span class="line"><!---->1. Just <!----></span>https://pdfium-review.googlesource.com/c/pdfium/+/97751<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://pdfium-review.googlesource.com/c/pdfium/+/97751"><!---->https://pdfium-review.googlesource.com/c/pdfium/+/97751<!----></a><br>2.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM

    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    Send email<chops-checkbox checked="true">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>

          <label for="newHotlistName">New hotlist name:</label>
          <input type="text" name="newHotlistName">
        </div>
        
      <br>
      
    
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">
            Discard
          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
    
    <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">
      
      <h3 class="medium-heading">Add issue to hotlists</h3>
    
      
      
      <input id="filter" type="text">
      <i class="material-icons">search</i>
    
      <form id="issueHotlistsForm">
        
      <div class="user-hotlists">
        
      </div>

      <div class="snackbar-container" aria-live="polite">
        
      </div>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
